text.__SUMMARY__: Potentilla nepalensis, common name Nepal cinquefoil, is a perennial plant species in the genus Potentilla.
text.Description: Potentilla nepalensis can reach a height of 30–60 centimetres (12–24 in). This plant forms low mounds of deep green strawberry-like leaves composed of broad leaflets. The cup-shaped 5-petalled flowers may be cherry red or deep pink, with a darker center, about 2.5 cm in width. They bloom July to August.
text.Distribution: This plant is native to E. Asia and W. Himalayas, from Pakistan to Nepal.
text.Habitat:
This species can be found in grazing grounds and cultivated areas, at elevation of 2,100–2,700 metres (6,900–8,900 ft) above sea level.
